CatDescriptText: Mr. John A. Kilchenstein, messenger, 109 Burr Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 9, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that we are spending too much money for foreign aid? Do you think that what we have spent has halted the spread of communism?" answer reads: "Yes, and we are getting no reward for it.  We are giving out the aid and getting nothing in return.  There are no paybacks.  And I don't think that it is checking communism.  We've made a lot of foreign loans and they haven't won us a lot of friends."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of John A. Kilchenstein wearing dark fedora, eyeglasses, and patterned necktie, standing on Wood Street in front of store window with reflection of Raab Clothes sign, Downtown
